item.title: 邮轮公司维京号在美国首次公开募股 15 亿美元后股价上涨 12
item.description: 维京控股有限公司（Viking Holdings Ltd.）在扩大首次公开募股规模并募集 15.4 亿美元资金后的首个交易日中，股价攀升达 12%，这表明美国上市热潮继续扩大。【原文：Viking Holdings Ltd. shares climbed as much as 12% in the luxury cruise operator’s first trading session after an expanded initial public offering that raised $1.54 billion, a sign that the US listing revival continues to broaden.】

item.title: 巴里克首席执行官 "看不出有任何理由 "召开亲自出席的年会

item.title: 发行人需求超过对美联储的担忧，小额债券销售飙升
item.description: 2024 年前四个月，各州和市政府出售了 1 428 亿美元的长期市政债券，为近十年来最多，因为借贷需求超过了市场投资者对利率上升的担忧。【原文：States and municipalities sold $142.8 billion in long-term municipal bonds during the first four months of 2024, the most in almost a decade, as the need to borrow outweighed concerns over higher interest rates that afflicted investors in the market.】

item.title: 印度炼油巨头加入关键油价交易大军
item.description: 印度信实工业有限公司（Reliance Industries Ltd.）是全球最大炼油厂的所有者，它加入了越来越多的原油交易公司的行列，而原油是市场最重要的价格基准。【原文：India’s Reliance Industries Ltd., owner of the world’s largest oil refinery, joined a growing army of firms trading crude that underpins the market’s most important price benchmark, the latest sign of how the measure has been transformed by an infusion of US supply.】

item.title: 美联储已永久搁置，但仍无需担心
item.description: 在 FOMC 决策日，美国央行行长们的政策路径似乎已经被定价。由于债券损失可能受到限制，这甚至可能是一个买入机会。盈利报告显示，股市也不会承受过大的压力。当然，风险在于高于目标的通胀和更高更长的利率可能带来的压力。【原文：On FOMC decision day, it feels as if US central bankers’ policy path has already been priced in. With bond losses likely capped, this might even be a buying opportunity. Earnings reports show equities shouldn’t be under undue pressure, either. The risk, of course, lies in the potential pinch from above-target inflation — and higher-for-longer rates.】

An affordability crisis caused by decades of underinvestment in housing is being compounded by persistently high interest rates, which are jacking up costs for borrowers when they remortgage their properties. Housing costs were inflated partly by economic mismanagement under former premier Liz Truss, and the Conservat】

item.title: 比尔-黄受审：针对 Archegos 创始人的刑事案件解析
item.description: 黄成国（Sung Kook "Bill" Hwang）通过他的 "家族办公室 "Archegos Capital Management 管理自己的财富，在华尔街保持低调。但 2021 年 3 月，Archegos 突然倒闭，成为头条新闻，几乎抹去了 Hwang 360 亿美元的财富。这次倒闭也让公司的贷款人损失了 100 亿美元，导致瑞士信贷集团（Credit Suisse Group AG）倒闭。【原文：Sung Kook “Bill” Hwang maintained a low profile on Wall Street as he managed his own wealth through his “family office,” known as Archegos Capital Management. But then Archegos suddenly melted down in March 2021, making headlines and all but erasing Hwang’s $36 billion fortune. The collapse also cost the firm’s lenders $10 billion, contributing to the downfall of Credit Suisse Group AG.】
